comment: When playing Minecraft on the PC i can easily build what i created on my Nexus!

title: I've tried many,
comment: But this is by far THE BEST pixel art app. It's simple and elegant. It has almost all the options you'll ever need. I love it.

title: Lovely little pixel drawing tool
comment: Everything works just as it should; intuitive and flexible too. The only thing I'd wish for would be zooming in/out working, so that I could work on more than 40x40 pixels or so on my phone and still do detail work!  (The app has a 64x64 limit, but my eyes and finger accuracy are the issues.) I'm happy that I bought it and do not regret the purchase a bit.      (Later edit: Color picker or, failing that, a longer-than-16-color color buffer would also be awesome.)
Samsung S3
No open file option

title: Quality, but missing some features
comment: Definitely the nicest look and feel of any pixel art app on android. However, it desperately needs zoom and eyedropper tools. This is the only reason I dont use this app more often. Of course things like layers and selection tools would be nice, but they are not as crucial.

title: Needs improvement
comment: This app has two major flaws which have taken it's rating down. One. It needs the ability to zoom in and out. This is pretty much standard in all pixel editors I've used so far. Two. The back button NEEDS to be fixed. One accidental press of the back button and the whole app quits, destroying any progress or image you've created instantly. This needs a confirmation screen rather than just being an instant quit.

title: Totes fab

I'd like to be able to save color palettes, and the zoom is almost totally unresponsive. Please fix the zoom issue. Cheers

title: One thing
comment: It'd be nice to be able to open small images that weren't made on this app, or were made on a different device. This app actually does zoom. Its a little tough to use, just use the normal two finger pinch/spread. Don't be discouraged if it doesn't work the first time. Swipe with two fingers to pan around while zoomed in

title: Very nice
comment: The main thing an app needs is easily accessible tools for the user and this app has everything you could need right there on the screen at once. The way the color selection is implemented is also very convenient as it remembers what colors you recently picked and that it is once again very easy to use, yet one can be as detailed in color as they like.  Freaking great app!

title: I <3 Pixels
comment: Great app but needs more tools, eye dropper, custom palettes, layers and transparent backgrounds.  Also need the option to delete saved work but simple, effective and easy to use.

title: Really love it and wanting more
comment: This is a really great app, no question. Best pixel editor I've found on Android. Features include: Pencil, Eraser, Line, Rectangle, Ellipse, Fill, Color Picker, Color History, Undo, Redo, Zoom, Custom Resolution, Exporting. Features not yet included: Importing (you can only work with art you created with it), Custom Palettes (create, save, load), Layers, Eye Dropper (select existing colors) I really hope the developer adds these tools, because the app has great potential.

title: Great Interface

title: Where have you been all my life?
comment: Charming and clever in its simpleness, this is the definitive pixel art app, period. I've used a lot of different drawing tools and this is by far one of the top pixel programs.  It's Easy to use with great "no fuss" options. I would easily pay for this. Suggestions, add a color copy option. Would be nice for editing older images. Not necessary but maybe include an import option.  AWESOME JOB on this app.

title: Just needs three more features...
comment: This is one of the greatest apps of its kind, but a zoom in\out mode and a 'fill-in' tool (usually symbolized as a paint bucket in most "paint" programs that have it), and a 'drag-and-drop' tool.  Those three features would really improve this already terrific app!
Good. But an odd problem: sometimes the toolbar is at bottom and sometimes at right side(in portrait).

It would be really great to allow the user to specify an arbitrary output dimensions for their .png files.  Also, I  really desperately could have used a "nudge" tool.  Aside from that, it's a really neat little tool!
